artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsujiokaya Bunsuke; Carver: Watanabe Eizō I
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 181; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 297.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; man at right with his back to and partially covered by radiating orange flames, with mouth open and hair blowing forward; four men fall on top of each other at center, with flakes around them; other fleeing men in ULQ
dimension: 14 1/4 × 10 in. (36.2 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Carver’s seal R: 彫工渡辺栄蔵 {Horikō Watanabe Eizō} | Censor seal: 寅十二改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: L, R: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Picture of Odai Matarokurō Setting His Own Castle on Fire, Calmly Entering the Fiery Pit and Dying; Enemy Troops Were Amazed at His Bravery
